title: "Looking Back on 2021"
date: 2021-12-31T20:18:33+09:00
slug: "look_back_2021"
categories: ["Reflection"]
image: "20211231200000.png"
description: "An article roughly looking back on 2021. This year we started a shop, got used to life in Fukuoka, and it was a fun year."
draft: false
---

> This article was translated from Japanese by Claude Code.

![](20211231200000_0.png)

Looking back on 2021 in a blog post.

(Past articles: [2018](/en/posts/2018_12_31_235950/), [2019](/en/posts/look_back_all_2019/),
[2020](/en/posts/look_back_2020/))

# January

[blog.shoheikawano.com](/en/posts/look_back_january_2021/)

Apparently I got Daikichi (great luck) at the New Year's shrine visit. Curious about my 2022 fortune too. Planning to go tomorrow.
Turned 29, set goals, and apparently saw my first snow since moving here (a blizzard).

# February

[blog.shoheikawano.com](/en/posts/look_back_february_2021/)

Apparently I cooked for my wife's birthday and went to an oyster hut.
Around this time I started touching KMM little by little.

# March

[blog.shoheikawano.com](/en/posts/look_back_march_2021/)

Around this time I was making pound cake, went to see cherry blossoms 🌸 at Ohori Park, and since Daru-chan came to visit, we drank. Also went to Hiroshima.

# April

[blog.shoheikawano.com](/en/posts/look_back_april_2021/)

Returned to Kumamoto.
Corona spread again and our wedding party was cancelled.
The wedding gifts we received around this time, I still use them all carefully. Thank you.
It was a month where I went to Tokyo just for a photo shoot and drank with some friends at an Airbnb.

# May

[blog.shoheikawano.com](/en/posts/look_back_may_2021/)

A month where I went to TOHO OFFICE, watched several movies, and kept trying out technologies in personal development.

# June

[blog.shoheikawano.com](/en/posts/look_back_june_2021/)

A month when cicadas started chirping and it started feeling like summer.
A month where I went to Dazaifu Tenmangu to see hydrangeas and bought a MIDI keyboard to do DTM.

# July

[blog.shoheikawano.com](/en/posts/look_back_july_2021/)

Casually traveled to Yamaguchi Prefecture, tried buying a glass pen (I broke it recently...), and watched the movie "Belle." I really couldn't think of a topic for DroidKaigi, but I want to have confidence in my topics next year.

# August

[blog.shoheikawano.com](/en/posts/look_back_august_2021/)

Ate shaved ice, went to the aquarium, and finished converting my personal app to Compose. I haven't touched Compose much since then, so I want to work with Compose in 2022. (Wishful thinking)

# September

[blog.shoheikawano.com](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_september_2021)

My wife's physical stationery store (previously online-only) opened, and I became responsible for the café section. My wife did almost all the preparation for the opening. Customers have been coming steadily, and acquaintances sometimes stop by, for which I'm very grateful. Thank you. If you visit Fukuoka in the future, I'd be happy if you could stop by if you have time (^o^) (We're basically open on weekends)

# October

[blog.shoheikawano.com](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_october_2021)

I bought a Pixel 6 but haven't used it as my main phone yet... (It's big and heavier than expected.)

Nokonoshima was really nice, so I want to go again next year.

I wrote in this blog, "I'm sure before I know it, it'll be year-end..." and I want to tell my past self, "That's exactly right."

# November

[blog.shoheikawano.com](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_november_2021)

Went on a business trip to Tokyo and had fun with people at the office. I once again felt that physical attendance and face-to-face communication are important. Krispy Kreme Donuts, which I could have eaten in Tokyo if I wanted, had a limited edition sale, and my chiropractor kindly bought some and delivered them to my shop. I'd like to take this opportunity to express my gratitude.

# December

[blog.shoheikawano.com](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_december_2021)

And this month, we went to a Christmas market, went to the oyster hut again, and had pillows custom-made to fit our bodies.

Yesterday was our shop's last workday of the year, and today I was cleaning the house.

---

Below are things I started and stopped this year.

Things I started this year:
- The shop
- Momotetsu (recently)
- Morning walks (recently)

Things I stopped this year:
- Journaling (handwritten)
- Technical presentations

## Summary

It's been a year since I moved to Fukuoka, and I've adapted to life in Fukuoka. It was also a month with big new challenges like starting a shop.

In 2022, I'll resume technical presentations. At work, I'm conscious of maintaining a 50-50 ratio between management and development roles, but lately I've only been occasionally writing tips blogs, so I intend to acquire enough knowledge to have topics for presentations.

Also, in December I did some small backend API development work. Up until now, I've only done Android app development, but I want to continue taking on new challenges next year too.

Well then, happy new year everyone~!

Customers have been coming steadily, and acquaintances sometimes stop by, for which I'm very grateful. Thank you. If you visit Fukuoka in the future, I'd be happy if you could stop by if you have time (^o^) (We're basically open on weekends)

---
title: "Looking Back on 2022"
date: 2022-12-31T18:22:17+09:00
slug: "look_back_2022"
categories: ["Reflection"]
image: "20221231181819.png"
description: "An article roughly looking back on 2021. This year we started a shop, got used to life in Fukuoka, and it was a fun year."
draft: false
---

> This article was translated from Japanese by Claude Code.

![](20221231181819_0.png)
*omikuji-2022*

Looking back on 2022 in a blog post.

(Past articles: [2018](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/2018/12/31/235950), [2019](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_all_2019),
[2020](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_2020), [2021](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_2021))

---

## Looking Back

### Work

At work, I continued focusing on Android, with some KMM, a bit of Compose, and also handled hiring and cross-organizational matters. Regarding engineering, everyone at the company is excellent, so I felt like I was desperately trying to keep up. However, I also delegated more things, and if I think about the ratio of development to other work, it felt like about 4:6, which I think was a good balance.

Overall, I often tried to do too many things and ended up half-baking them, so for work next year, I want to properly do the obvious things like deciding what not to do and focusing.

### Personal Life

##### Blog

This year I stopped doing monthly retrospective blogs. As expected, I only wrote 2 blog posts. I had written about my determination to study hard enough to give presentations and produce solid output, but I didn't really study or develop enough to give presentations, so I deeply regret that.

##### Development

I was developing my personal project bit by bit, but it was mainly library updates, so I essentially did nothing (?). I want to add features next year.

Also, since my wife does EC-related work, I started touching Shopify-related things little by little in the latter half. I want to go from "I don't understand anything" to "I understand a little bit." Also, I'll release a Multiplatform app.

##### ☕

Lately, more people have been saying it's "delicious," which makes me genuinely happy. I'll keep practicing latte art persistently and want to be able to draw clean hearts and leaves.

### Summary

2022 started with Daikichi (great luck) fortune and I made "health first" my motto. My health checkup showed no issues, and aside from vaccine side effects and getting COVID, I didn't get seriously sick, so that was good. Next year I'll clear all of Ring Fit Adventure. I want to continue doing what I want to do while staying healthy next year too.

It's vague but that's just how it is! Thanks for your hard work~~!

lines: Looking back on 2022 in a blog post.

---
title: "Looking Back on January 2019"
date: 2019-02-09T20:35:18+09:00
slug: "look_back_january_2019"
categories: ["Reflection"]
image: "20190304003655.png"
draft: false
---

> [!NOTE]
> This article has been translated by Gemini.

January ended in no time (ﾟ∀px) KITAKORE. As of writing, 2019 has surprisingly dropped below 90% [Wall]ｮﾟωﾟ;))) GAKUBURU

So, let's look back on January.

## First Shrine Visit of the Year

![f:id:shaunkawano:20190304003655p:plain](20190304003655_0.png)

To Yoyogi Hachimangu.

![f:id:shaunkawano:20190304003658p:plain](20190304003658.png)

Middle luck. I think last year was small luck, so good.

## Returned Home

I took a temporary trip back home a little after the new year because the flights were cheaper if I shifted the timing.

![f:id:shaunkawano:20190304003701p:plain](20190304003701.png)

The photo was taken inside Aso Shrine.

## Matching Dev Meetup#2 - ServerSide

![f:id:shaunkawano:20190304003703p:plain](20190304003703.png)

The photo was taken at Eureka, Inc., the venue for Matching Dev Meetup.

From our company, Rui-san from the SRE team and Kawano-san, an Engineering Manager, spoke! The next one is planned with a different theme, so stay tuned...! The connpass page might be public soon?

## Others

### Watched I Feel Pretty

It was a story about a woman concerned about her body type who, after hitting her head, hallucinated that she had obtained her ideal appearance (her actual appearance didn't change at all), which triggered changes in her relationships and environment.

[www.youtube.com](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cVx9EFK3DWE)

No matter how much you envy someone or how confident they look, they surely have anxieties, and not everyone has self-esteem. It conveyed that for people who lack confidence or can't praise themselves, if they change their way of thinking just a little, maybe confidence will sprout bit by bit.

I also watched Bohemian Rhapsody. It was a movie I'm glad I saw in a theater!

### Went to Bunkitsu

I went to a bookstore called "Bunkitsu" in Roppongi.

[bunkitsu.jp](http://bunkitsu.jp/)

For 1,500 yen per entry, there is Wi-Fi / power / lockers, and coffee etc. is free to drink. There are many books and of course you can pick them up and read them at your seat freely. I thought 1,500 yen might be a bit expensive, but paying made me feel like I had to read properly, and even though I'm bad at reading through all at once, I was able to finish one book on the spot.

I completely understood Elon Musk.

![f:id:shaunkawano:20190304003708p:plain](20190304003708.png)

There are books lined up like this.

![f:id:shaunkawano:20190304003711p:plain](20190304003711.png)

There are work spaces and spaces where you can lie down while reading, which seemed good.

It was a place where I could concentrate so much that I'd want to come about twice a month.

Also, [I turned 27](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/from26_to_27) and was constantly thinking about creating materials for DroidKaigi.

There are many point-like reflections, but January was like this. Loose 💩

Good work in January too!!

file.content:
---
title: "I presented at DroidKaigi 2019 with the title \"Technical Strategy for Further Growing the App\""
date: 2019-02-09T18:45:25+09:00
slug: "look_back_droidkaigi_2019"
categories: ["android", "droidkaigi", "Reflection"]
image: "20190209184119.png"
draft: false
---

> [!NOTE]
> This article has been translated by Gemini.

# What is DroidKaigi 2019?

It's a conference for sharing technical information and communication about Android. It has been held every year since 2015, and in 2019, it was held for two days from February 7th to 8th.

[droidkaigi.jp](https://droidkaigi.jp/2019/)

### Presentation Content

I spoke in a 50-minute slot for the first time with the title "Technical Strategy for Further Growing the App".

The content mainly introduced the "Technical Strategy" our technical organization is performing with the goal of further growing the rapidly growing product I'm currently in charge of through technology, and sharing my personal reflections from there.

[speakerdeck.com](https://speakerdeck.com/shoheikawano/tech-strategy-for-boosting-app-growth)

### Preparation for the Talk

It was my first time creating materials with such emotional content. Because of that, it was a kind of challenge for me. When creating the presentation materials, I worried most about what kind of structure to use.

I wrote out the table of contents and things I wanted to convey, but once I started making the slides, I wondered "Is this flow easy to understand?", and after writing out a certain amount, I suddenly became negative, thinking "Is anyone interested in this talk?". Because of that, even after writing out the content I wanted to convey in a notepad, I spent a lot of time thinking about how to drop it into slides and whether it would be easier to understand if I talked about the premise to some extent.

The hurriedness of finishing it forcefully at the end (not ideal at all) was the same as before.

### Reflection on the Day

As a reflection point, there were several times when I had to rephrase or couldn't find the right word on the spot and stopped for about a second.
(I apologize to everyone who came to listen and found it difficult to hear. 🙇‍♂️) I think this just comes down to a lack of time for practice... However, I want to take it positively that it was better than last year and that I have to keep gaining experience, and try not to get too depressed.

The good thing was that there were more people who resonated and gave reactions than I expected! After the talk, I was happier than anything to be able to talk about my presentation content with various people in the exhibition hall or on Twitter, through questions or conversations of resonance, more than [last year](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/2018/02/10/150115).

Also, several engineers from the same company came to see me, which was encouraging at the presentation venue (honestly, I thought people from our company or group should listen to other people's talks because it would be more beneficial!). Thank you very much 🙏

# Gratitude

---
title: "Looking Back on the Second Half of 2025"
date: 2025-12-31T17:34:04+09:00
slug: "look_back_2025_the_second_half"
categories: ["Reflection"]
image: "20251231015934.jpg"
description: "In this article, I look back on the second half of 2025, reflecting on both work and personal life. Thank you for a great 2025!"
draft: false
---

> This article was translated from Japanese by Claude Code.

2025 has flown by so quickly. Let me look back on the second half of 2025.

You can find my first half retrospective [here](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_2025_the_first_half).

## Work

### AI-Related

After wrapping up a major project in the first half of 2025, I tried some new things like conducting job interviews and presenting at internal study sessions, but overall it felt like a more relaxed period.

Since I work at a company with a "Let's actively use AI!" culture, I've been exploring AI utilization while doing my regular development work. That said, the tools I use have become fairly fixed—just Claude Code and a few MCPs (like Figma and Jira).

I've started feeling tool fatigue, thinking "aren't there too many similar tools out there?" and have become reluctant to try new tools. I haven't touched any CLI-based AI tools other than Claude Code. I think it's best to focus on Claude Code as my foundation and experiment with "how to create another version of myself."

If asked whether I created something entirely new, not really—so next year I want to be able to show off something I've built, whether it's a personal project or work-related.

Also, the team suddenly grew quite large, and the manager seemed to be having a tough time. (Not my problem though.)

### Business Trip to Headquarters

I work in the Netherlands, but our headquarters is in the US, so more than half the people I work with live in America. I was given the opportunity to go on a business trip, so I went. I really felt how important it is to meet and talk with people face-to-face. I want to get better at English. (I'll probably think this for the rest of my life.)

I also visited Google headquarters, bought some souvenirs, and took a walk around. There was the Google Photos monument and the familiar Android mascot.

![](20251231015950.jpg)

![](20251231015954.jpg)

![](20251231015959.jpg)

## Personal Life

### Successfully Got a House

I mentioned it briefly in my previous retrospective blog, but I successfully got it. There are various issues, but I'm living comfortably. I wasn't interested in DIY and had an aversion to it, but as I assembled furniture, that aversion gradually decreased. Since rent is so high everywhere, I'm genuinely happy to have gotten my own home from an economic standpoint. I also got an espresso machine, so I've been practicing latte art in the mornings. I was posting a latte art diary on Instagram, but since Instagram consumes so much time, I've stepped away from it. Going forward, I'll post on Bluesky to keep a log.

![](20251231015929.jpg)

### Got a Bicycle

To become a true Dutch person (?), I got a foldable one. My commute changed from Home→Train→Metro→Office to Home→Train→Bicycle→Office. It's refreshing, and since it folds, I can bring it on the train. It was expensive, but it's definitely in my top 3 purchases that I'm glad I made.

> My new gear! I'll be careful not to get injured. That's all.
> — Shohei Kawano (@_shoheikawano) July 2, 2025

A few days later, I had a spectacular fall and got injured. (In front of Amsterdam Central Station—my tire got caught in the tram tracks.)

### Had a Full Medical Checkup

Since I'm in my 30s now, I figured I should get one done. No major issues found, so I'm relieved for now. It's important, but expensive, so I'm unsure whether to do it every year. I'll probably settle on once every 1-3 years.
I also had a colonoscopy, but emptying my intestines was incredibly difficult. It wasn't something to do while staying at my wife's parents' house. I felt bad about that...

### Drove a Car

I drove a rental car for several hours to Germany 🇩🇪. We went to a place called Aachen to visit a hot spring.

![](20251231173212.jpg)

[https://maps.app.goo.gl/G75YypzPnGJteQpQA](https://maps.app.goo.gl/G75YypzPnGJteQpQA)

The hot spring was amazing. And Aachen was great. Everything is cheaper compared to the Netherlands, and supermarkets have better selection... I'm jealous.

But I hate Deutsche Bahn (German railways). (So I'll continue going by car.)

### Got New Glasses

> My new gear
> — shoheikawano (@shoheikawano.com) 2025-12-30

We bought nice ones as Christmas presents for each other. I got photochromic lenses that change color in response to UV light. I've only been using them for a short while, but I really like them.

### Other Things

- Ordered a car lease (should be ready from New Year)
- Former colleagues from my previous job came to the Netherlands on a business trip and we went drinking
- Got shingles
- Went to Disneyland Paris. Entered in the afternoon and thoroughly enjoyed it. Had delicious food at Remy's Ratatouille restaurant
- Went to Czech Republic and met a colleague in person. The following week, that colleague came to the Netherlands on a business trip. They had kept their Netherlands trip a secret!
- Attended my wife's brother's and best friend's weddings. They were absolutely amazing
- And so on

## Summary

Following last year, 2025 was full of various life events. I wasn't always healthy—I got shingles—but overall it was a healthy year. After spending a full year in the Netherlands and comparing life and work styles between Japan and the Netherlands, I have many thoughts, which I'll write about sometime next year.

## Other Photos

![](20251231015934_5.jpg)

A ship I photographed at SAIL Amsterdam, a ship festival held once every 5 years. They were all huge. Some looked like pirate ships.

![](20251231015938.jpg)

Had a sangria party in the garden. It was the best!

---

On December 31st, I'm going to make a cake (couldn't make one at Christmas) and eat toshikoshi soba (year-crossing noodles)!

Thank you everyone for a great 2025. Happy New Year!

---
title: "Looking Back on January 2019"
date: 2019-02-09T20:35:18+09:00
slug: "look_back_january_2019"
categories: ["Reflection"]
image: "20190304003655.png"
draft: false
---

> [!NOTE]
> This article has been translated by Gemini.

January ended in no time (ﾟ∀px) KITAKORE. As of writing, 2019 has surprisingly dropped below 90% [Wall]ｮﾟωﾟ;))) GAKUBURU

So, let's look back on January.

## First Shrine Visit of the Year

![f:id:shaunkawano:20190304003655p:plain](20190304003655_0.png)

To Yoyogi Hachimangu.

![f:id:shaunkawano:20190304003658p:plain](20190304003658.png)

Middle luck. I think last year was small luck, so good.

## Returned Home

I took a temporary trip back home a little after the new year because the flights were cheaper if I shifted the timing.

![f:id:shaunkawano:20190304003701p:plain](20190304003701.png)

The photo was taken inside Aso Shrine.

## Matching Dev Meetup#2 - ServerSide

![f:id:shaunkawano:20190304003703p:plain](20190304003703.png)

The photo was taken at Eureka, Inc., the venue for Matching Dev Meetup.

From our company, Rui-san from the SRE team and Kawano-san, an Engineering Manager, spoke! The next one is planned with a different theme, so stay tuned...! The connpass page might be public soon?

## Others

### Watched I Feel Pretty

It was a story about a woman concerned about her body type who, after hitting her head, hallucinated that she had obtained her ideal appearance (her actual appearance didn't change at all), which triggered changes in her relationships and environment.

[www.youtube.com](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cVx9EFK3DWE)

No matter how much you envy someone or how confident they look, they surely have anxieties, and not everyone has self-esteem. It conveyed that for people who lack confidence or can't praise themselves, if they change their way of thinking just a little, maybe confidence will sprout bit by bit.

I also watched Bohemian Rhapsody. It was a movie I'm glad I saw in a theater!

### Went to Bunkitsu

I went to a bookstore called "Bunkitsu" in Roppongi.

[bunkitsu.jp](http://bunkitsu.jp/)

For 1,500 yen per entry, there is Wi-Fi / power / lockers, and coffee etc. is free to drink. There are many books and of course you can pick them up and read them at your seat freely. I thought 1,500 yen might be a bit expensive, but paying made me feel like I had to read properly, and even though I'm bad at reading through all at once, I was able to finish one book on the spot.

I completely understood Elon Musk.

![f:id:shaunkawano:20190304003708p:plain](20190304003708.png)

There are books lined up like this.

![f:id:shaunkawano:20190304003711p:plain](20190304003711.png)

There are work spaces and spaces where you can lie down while reading, which seemed good.

It was a place where I could concentrate so much that I'd want to come about twice a month.

Also, [I turned 27](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/from26_to_27) and was constantly thinking about creating materials for DroidKaigi.

There are many point-like reflections, but January was like this. Loose 💩

Good work in January too!!

title: "Looking Back on February 2019"
date: 2019-03-12T23:44:16+09:00
slug: "look_back_february_2019"
categories: ["Reflection"]
image: "20190312233025.png"
draft: false
---

> [!NOTE]
> This article has been translated by Gemini.

> It is now March 12, 2019. There are 295 days left this year. That's 80.8% left.
> — Remaining Days of the Year (@remaining_days) [March 11, 2019](https://twitter.com/remaining_days/status/1105121202958348291?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

About 20% of 2019 is over. Shocking･ﾟ･(*ﾉДﾉ)･ﾟ･

So, let's look back on February.

## Participated in DroidKaigi

I looked back on DroidKaigi in [this article](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_droidkaigi_2019). I was happy to be able to speak this year as well, following last year. This year I swung towards emotional content rather than technical, so I want to swing towards more technical content for next year's CFP.

## Held Android Weekend

We held Android Weekend in February too. The number of participants is increasing very gradually, so I want to continue at this rate. (Anyone who wants to practice speaking English, please join!)

The next one is planned for April. @ the new Shibuya office

Below is Eoin presenting about Navigation Component at Android Weekend.

![f:id:shaunkawano:20190312233022p:plain](20190312233022.png)

Scene from the after-party.

![f:id:shaunkawano:20190312233028p:plain](20190312233028.png)

[twitter.com](https://twitter.com/androidweekend)

## Participated in CyberAgent Android Beerbash! LT and Fireside Chat

[cyberagent.connpass.com](https://cyberagent.connpass.com/event/119309/)

I spoke at a session where we loosely talked with members from our company who were involved in DroidKaigi, about things like my current team, Google I/O, evaluations, DroidKaigi, etc.

The after-party was particularly lively, and it was good to be able to enjoy chatting while standing around until after 11:00. If you are interested in our company, please contact me via Twitter DM or anything.

## Others

### Hooked on Making French Toast

Exactly as it sounds. Since my housemate likes bread and such, and I like honey and maple syrup, I started making it and now I'm starting to feel like mastering it.

Total 3 times. Getting used to it little by little.

![f:id:shaunkawano:20190312233025p:plain](20190312233025_2.png)

### Climbed Tokyo Tower by Stairs

Exactly as it sounds. It was very tiring, but felt refreshing.

There are about 600 steps, it takes about 15 minutes, and there are quiz panels here and there as you climb so you can enjoy climbing while stopping to think. If you haven't tried it yet, please do.

![f:id:shaunkawano:20190312233018p:plain](20190312233018.png)

That's all, good work in February too!!

title: "Looking Back on January 2021"
date: 2021-02-03T20:00:00+09:00
slug: "look_back_january_2021"
categories: ["Reflection"]
image: "20210102102741.png"

> [!NOTE]
> This article has been translated by Gemini.

I'll continue the reflection blog loosely this year too.

> It is now February 3, 2021. There are 332 days left this year. That's 91.0% left.
> — Remaining Days of the Year (@remaining_days) [February 2, 2021](https://twitter.com/remaining_days/status/1356618441008975875?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

9% of this year is already done.

"Strike while the iron is hot", so I want to do everything proactively.
So, looking back on this month.

## Went for Hatsumode

To Gokoku Shrine.

![](20210102102728.png)

This year was Daikichi (Great Luck). Last year was Kichi (Good Luck) apparently.

[Looking Back on January 2020 - heihei blog](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_january_2020)

![](20210102102735.png)

🐮

![](20210102102741_2.png)

## 🎂

![](20210203090711.png)

Turned 29 on 1/24. Eek.

So, I received wedding gifts etc. from various people (Thank you very much).

But, I'll leave dried sweet potatoes here without learning my lesson. → [🍠](https://www.amazon.jp/hz/wishlist/ls/1LXLB0XUP4L40?ref_=wl_share)

I wrote down obvious goals like reading books and taking on new challenges at work.
Even things that should obviously be done tend to be neglected when I get busy, so I wrote them down properly so I can look back and correct course. I put it in front of my desk and look at it occasionally (just looking).

## It Snowed

![](20210203090737.jpg)

Saw snow for the first time since coming to Fukuoka. It was really a blizzard in the photo. It snowed in Tokyo recently too, I think.

So that's about it.

The state of emergency was extended, and there's no atmosphere to travel abroad yet at all, but I hope things settle down soon so we can go.

Health comes first, let's go :yatteiki: this year too.

---
title: "I presented at DroidKaigi 2019 with the title \"Technical Strategy for Further Growing the App\""
date: 2019-02-09T18:45:25+09:00
slug: "look_back_droidkaigi_2019"
categories: ["android", "droidkaigi", "Reflection"]
image: "20190209184119.png"
draft: false
---

> [!NOTE]
> This article has been translated by Gemini.

# What is DroidKaigi 2019?

It's a conference for sharing technical information and communication about Android. It has been held every year since 2015, and in 2019, it was held for two days from February 7th to 8th.

[droidkaigi.jp](https://droidkaigi.jp/2019/)

### Presentation Content

I spoke in a 50-minute slot for the first time with the title "Technical Strategy for Further Growing the App".

The content mainly introduced the "Technical Strategy" our technical organization is performing with the goal of further growing the rapidly growing product I'm currently in charge of through technology, and sharing my personal reflections from there.

[speakerdeck.com](https://speakerdeck.com/shoheikawano/tech-strategy-for-boosting-app-growth)

### Preparation for the Talk

It was my first time creating materials with such emotional content. Because of that, it was a kind of challenge for me. When creating the presentation materials, I worried most about what kind of structure to use.

I wrote out the table of contents and things I wanted to convey, but once I started making the slides, I wondered "Is this flow easy to understand?", and after writing out a certain amount, I suddenly became negative, thinking "Is anyone interested in this talk?". Because of that, even after writing out the content I wanted to convey in a notepad, I spent a lot of time thinking about how to drop it into slides and whether it would be easier to understand if I talked about the premise to some extent.

The hurriedness of finishing it forcefully at the end (not ideal at all) was the same as before.

### Reflection on the Day

As a reflection point, there were several times when I had to rephrase or couldn't find the right word on the spot and stopped for about a second.
(I apologize to everyone who came to listen and found it difficult to hear. 🙇‍♂️) I think this just comes down to a lack of time for practice... However, I want to take it positively that it was better than last year and that I have to keep gaining experience, and try not to get too depressed.

The good thing was that there were more people who resonated and gave reactions than I expected! After the talk, I was happier than anything to be able to talk about my presentation content with various people in the exhibition hall or on Twitter, through questions or conversations of resonance, more than [last year](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/2018/02/10/150115).

Also, several engineers from the same company came to see me, which was encouraging at the presentation venue (honestly, I thought people from our company or group should listen to other people's talks because it would be more beneficial!). Thank you very much 🙏

# Gratitude

Every year, I can enjoy DroidKaigi like this thanks to the organizers. Thank you very much. and good work!!

![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-BUgACiCkZ30/XF4VSfh9jJI/AAAAAAAAzE0/HdJwO-zv3cEuOhkAVyi1YsseuojVsufWACE0YBhgL/s1024/IMG_20190209_084754.jpg)

P.S. In a sense, DroidKaigi starts now. I want to look back at the videos and materials and internalize everyone's knowledge in my work and personal development.
